definitions: sound loud or clear enough to be perceived by the human ear
examples: The music was barely audible over the crowd noise
She spoke in an audible whisper during the ceremony

definitions: sound especially when recorded, transmitted, or reproduced electronically
examples: The audio quality on this recording is excellent
We need to check the audio levels before broadcasting

definitions: educational or instructional materials that use both sight and sound to convey information
examples: The teacher used audiovisual aids to explain the concept
The conference room needs new audiovisual equipment for presentations

definitions: official examination and verification of accounts and financial records
systematic review or assessment of something for accuracy or quality
examples: The company undergoes an annual audit by external accountants
The tax audit revealed several discrepancies in their records
The safety audit identified several areas needing improvement
We conducted an audit of our current marketing strategies

definitions: practical demonstration of skill by a performer seeking a role
the sense or faculty of hearing
examples: She has an audition for the lead role tomorrow
The director saw hundreds of actors during auditions
The doctor tested the patient's audition with various frequencies
His audition was impaired after years of loud music

definitions: person who conducts an audit of accounts or financial records
person who attends a course without receiving academic credit
examples: The auditor discovered irregularities in the expense reports
An independent auditor reviews our books every quarter
Several auditors sit in on the philosophy lectures each semester
As an auditor, she could attend classes but not take exams

definitions: large room or building used for public gatherings, performances, or lectures
examples: The school auditorium seats over eight hundred people
The concert will be held in the civic auditorium downtown

definitions: process of making something greater by adding to it in size, number, or strength
examples: The augmentation of staff helped reduce customer wait times
Breast augmentation is one of the most common cosmetic procedures

definitions: affectionate or familiar term for one's aunt or an older woman
examples: My auntie always brings the best presents for birthdays
The children call their neighbor Auntie May out of respect

definitions: alternative spelling of auntie, used as familiar term for aunt
examples: Aunty Sarah makes the best chocolate cake in the family
The kids love visiting their aunty on weekends

definitions: distinctive atmosphere or quality that seems to surround a person or thing
supposed emanation surrounding the body of a living creature
examples: She had an aura of confidence that impressed everyone
The old mansion had a mysterious aura about it
Some people claim they can see colored auras around individuals
The psychic said my aura was particularly bright today

definitions: natural electrical phenomenon creating bright lights in the sky near polar regions
examples: The aurora borealis painted green ribbons across the northern sky
Tourists travel to Alaska hoping to see the aurora

definitions: sternness or severity of manner, attitude, or appearance
difficult economic conditions created by government measures to reduce spending
examples: The monastery was known for its austerity and simple living
Her austerity of dress reflected her serious personality
The government imposed austerity measures to reduce the deficit
Many citizens protested against the harsh austerity policies

definitions: film director who influences their films so much that they rank as their author
examples: Hitchcock is considered a true auteur of cinema
The festival celebrates auteur filmmaking from around the world

definitions: process or action of proving or showing something to be true, genuine, or valid
examples: Two-factor authentication adds extra security to your account
The painting required authentication before the auction could proceed

definitions: quality of being authentic, genuine, real, or true to one's own personality or character
examples: Experts questioned the authenticity of the ancient manuscript
Her authenticity as a leader earned everyone's respect

definitions: official permission or approval for an action, especially from someone in authority
examples: You need authorisation from the manager to access those files
The bank requires written authorisation for large withdrawals

definitions: person who believes in or practices strict obedience to authority at expense of personal freedom
examples: The authoritarian demanded absolute obedience from his subordinates
History shows many authoritarians eventually lose public support

definitions: principle of blind submission to authority and suppression of individual freedom of thought or action
examples: The country slid into authoritarianism after the military coup
Critics warned against the creeping authoritarianism in government policies

definitions: official permission or approval for an action, especially from someone in authority
examples: She received authorization to proceed with the project
The purchase order requires authorization from two managers

definitions: state or fact of being the writer of a book, article, or document
examples: The authorship of the anonymous letter remains a mystery
She finally acknowledged authorship of the controversial essay

definitions: developmental disorder characterized by difficulties with social interaction, communication, and repetitive behaviors
examples: Early intervention can help children with autism develop important skills
The school has special programs designed for students with autism

definitions: account of a person's life written by that person themselves
examples: The celebrity's autobiography revealed many unknown details
She spent years writing her autobiography after retiring

definitions: system of government by one person with absolute power over all others
examples: The nation transformed from autocracy to democracy after the revolution
Many citizens grew tired of living under autocracy

definitions: ruler who has absolute power over a country or organization
examples: The autocrat ruled the kingdom with an iron fist
History remembers him as a benevolent autocrat who modernized the nation

definitions: person's own signature, especially of a celebrity written for an admirer
manuscript or document written in the author's own handwriting
examples: Fans waited hours to get the singer's autograph
The baseball player signed autographs after the game
The museum displayed the autograph of Lincoln's famous speech
Collectors pay high prices for historical autographs

definitions: condition in which the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own healthy cells and tissues
examples: Autoimmunity can lead to various chronic diseases like lupus
Researchers are studying what triggers autoimmunity in certain individuals

definitions: company that designs, develops, manufactures, and sells automobiles
examples: The automaker announced plans for new electric vehicle models
Major automakers are investing heavily in autonomous driving technology

definitions: use of automatic equipment and systems to perform tasks previously done by humans
examples: Factory automation has increased production efficiency significantly
The company invested in automation to reduce labor costs

definitions: moving mechanical device made in imitation of a human being
person who acts in a mechanical or unemotional way
examples: The clockmaker created an intricate automaton that could write
Ancient Greeks designed automatons powered by water and steam
He moved through his daily routine like an automaton
The workers had become automatons after years of repetitive tasks

definitions: road vehicle powered by an engine, designed to carry a small number of passengers
examples: The automobile revolutionized transportation in the twentieth century
She learned to drive her first automobile at age sixteen

definitions: right or condition of self-government for a country or region
freedom from external control or influence in personal decisions
examples: The region gained autonomy after years of negotiations
The university has autonomy in setting its academic standards
Teenagers often struggle for more autonomy from their parents
The patient's autonomy must be respected in medical decisions

definitions: device for automatically steering ships, aircraft, or spacecraft without constant human control
examples: The pilot engaged the autopilot during the long flight
Modern cars now feature advanced autopilot capabilities

definitions: examination of a dead body to determine the cause of death or extent of disease
examples: The autopsy revealed the victim died from natural causes
The medical examiner performed an autopsy to gather evidence

definitions: season between summer and winter when leaves fall from trees and temperatures become cooler
examples: The leaves turn beautiful colors during autumn in New England
We always go apple picking in early autumn

definitions: person or thing providing supplementary or additional help and support
troops or equipment supplementing the main military forces
examples: The nurse works as an auxiliary in the emergency department
She joined the women's auxiliary at the local hospital
The army called in auxiliary forces during the crisis
Auxiliary power units provide backup electricity

definitions: use, benefit, or value of something in achieving a purpose or result
examples: Our efforts were of no avail against the storm
He tried to persuade her, but to little avail

definitions: mass of snow, ice, and rocks falling rapidly down a mountainside
sudden arrival or occurrence of something in overwhelming quantities
examples: The avalanche buried several homes at the base of the mountain
Skiers must be aware of avalanche conditions in backcountry areas
The company received an avalanche of complaints after the announcement
An avalanche of emails flooded her inbox Monday morning

definitions: extreme greed for wealth or material gain, often considered one of the seven deadly sins
examples: His avarice led him to betray his closest friends
The novel explores how avarice corrupts even good people

definitions: graphical representation of a user in a virtual space or game
manifestation of a deity or released soul in bodily form
examples: Players can customize their avatar's appearance in the game
She chose a cartoon avatar for her social media profile
In Hindu mythology, Vishnu has ten avatars including Krishna
The guru was believed to be an avatar of an ancient sage

definitions: person who takes revenge or punishes someone for wrongdoing on behalf of another
examples: The hero became an avenger after his family was killed
In the story, she transforms into an avenger seeking justice

definitions: strong dislike or disinclination toward something, often accompanied by desire to avoid it
examples: She has a strong aversion to public speaking
His aversion to conflict made him avoid all arguments

definitions: large enclosure or building for keeping birds, typically for observation, breeding, or display
examples: The zoo's tropical aviary houses exotic birds from rainforests
She built a small aviary in her backyard for finches

definitions: design, development, production, operation, and use of aircraft, especially heavier-than-air aircraft
examples: He studied aviation engineering at the technical college
The aviation industry faces new environmental regulations

definitions: person who pilots an aircraft, especially as a profession or skilled hobby
examples: The aviator performed stunning aerobatic maneuvers at the airshow
Early aviators faced many dangers in primitive aircraft

definitions: pear-shaped fruit with rough green skin, smooth oily edible flesh, and large stone
examples: She made fresh guacamole with ripe avocados and lime
Avocado toast has become a popular breakfast option

definitions: action of keeping away from or not doing something, especially deliberately
examples: His avoidance of difficult conversations created more problems
Tax avoidance through legal means differs from illegal tax evasion
